page.topic: How to Display a Three State Checkbox on a Grid Component
page.description: Logical values stored in a database can have three states: true, false, or NULL. Representing these three values can be done using checkboxes.

discussion.p: A checkbox is often used to display logical fields in an application. An unchecked box represents a false value while a checked box represents a true value. If the logical field can be NULL in the SQL database that stores the records, however, a two-state checkbox is not adequate. Both NULL and false are by default represented with an unchecked checkbox.

HTML checkboxes have a third state that can be used to represent NULL values in logical fields: "indeterminate". The indeterminate state is typically represent using a solid fill or dashed line in the checkbox. HTML does not directly support setting a checkbox to indeterminate. To set a checkbox to the indeterminate state, you must use JavaScript. For example:

section.description: JavaScript can be executed when a Grid row is rendered using the server-side [onExistingRowRender] event, allowing you to set NULL logical checkboxes to the indeterminate state when rendered:
section.example: dim flag as l flag = e.rowData.dataIsNull("ship_same") if flag then dim js as c js = "var checkbox = $('"+e.tmpl.alias+".V.R"+e.rowNumber+".SHIP_SAME');"+crlf()+\ "checkbox.indeterminate = true;" e.javascript = js end if
